repnme.cdata!: Republic of Yemen - Fifth Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Fifth Highway Project in Yemen. The
            primary objective of the project aimed at: (a) completing
            the establishment of an effective road maintenance
            organization; (b) creating an efficient, well-trained
            Highway Authority work force; and, (c) creating a sound
            basis for planning the future development of the road
            system. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was deficient. The key lessons
            learned were as follows: (i) after the major political event
            of the unification of the northern and southern parts of
            Yemen, the consequences of the Gulf crisis, and
            non-compliance with the legal covenants, project design
            should have been reassessed and the project restructured to
            ensure continued relevance and borrower commitment; (ii) the
            Association should not finance equipment, supplies and
            workshops until sufficient maintenance capabilities have
            been established, and sufficient funding for road
            maintenance has been made available to use the equipment;
            (iii) more care could be given to the process of selecting
            qualified consultants for technical assistance assignments
            that are critical to achieving project objectives and
            sustainability of the project; and (iv) parastatal
            contractors should only be allowed to bid for civil works
            contracts in competition with the private sector when their
            operations are managerially and financially autonomous.

18155363.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

repnme.cdata!:
People's Democratic Republic of Yemen
            - Fifth Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Highway Project aims to (a)
            complete the establishment of an effective road maintenance
            organization; (b) create a well trained workforce; and (c)
            create a sound basis for planning the development of the
            road system.  Accordingly, the project comprises (a) a
            three-year slice of a routine and periodic maintenance
            program (including procurement of routine maintenance
            equipment and buildings and additional workshop equipment
            for a new central workshop near Aden.  In addition, it
            entails (b) reconditioning of existing training facilities
            and provision of training equipment and materials; (c)
            technical assistance; (d) preparation of a road master plan;
            and (e) repair of road flood damage.  The Road Maintenance
            Program will benefit Government through less frequent costly
            road reconstruction, as well as road transport operators and
            motorists through lower vehicle operating costs on better roads.

docna.cdata!:
People's Democratic Republic of Yemen -
            Fifth Highway Project
